instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN_R: What is P5VS4RS3_EN_R? P5VS4RS3_EN_R is an enable signal that turns on the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. The _R means the signal is asserted when the voltage is high(3.3v). .
definitions.P5VS4RS3_PGOOD: What is P5VS4RS3_PGOOD? P5VS4RS3_PGOOD is a signal that confirms the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail is working properly. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: Missing <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Motherboard 00165 is not turning on
I used power supply and it is Consuming around .23amp
Missing Rail <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> so I don't have <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
I checked <CHIP>U7500</CHIP> and found Missing <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN_R</SIGNAL> at Pin 4, <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_PGOOD</SIGNAL> Pin 5 not sure if I need these to get chip turn on.
Repalced <CHIP>U7500</CHIP> but no results.

threads.title: Missing <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check first if you get a pulse there.
Look at the same moment when charger is connected, or manualy trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
5V should appear at L7520 if you remove <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR>.
